physical_appearance:The image shows an installation. It is rectangular in shape. The background of the installation is black in colour. There are numerous bright specks scattered throughout the entire installation. The installation resembles stars in a dark sky.
subject_terms_1:sky stars (extraterrestial bodies) celestial space (astronomical concept) force (mechanical concept) mixed media works

sgcool_label_text:Invisible Force reproduces part of the starry sky as photographed by NASA
 strictly in accordance with the location and the size of the stars
 by using nearly 30
000 industrial magnets that weigh almost two tonnes. Through the use of magnets
 the work ingeniously represents the invisible gravitational forces between the celestial bodies.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Invisible Force reproduces part of the starry sky as photographed by NASA, strictly in accordance with the location and the size of the stars, by using nearly 30,000 industrial magnets that weigh almost two tonnes. Through the use of magnets, the work ingeniously represents the invisible gravitational forces between the celestial bodies.
